result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Luis J Ortiz Hernandez was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to fine/costs.   Any remaining fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of alcohol.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Luis J Ortiz Hernandez in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter, sworn in.  Court makes order to fix defendants name on CCAP.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts number 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Count #4 is dismissed by operation of law.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Ledesma makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of 
3 Years Imprisonment (Credit -1 day )
18 months of Initial Confinement
18 months of Extended Supervision
Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Condition Time: 250 days Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith. 
FINE:  $1832.00 to be paid as a condition of probation, Bail to be applied. 
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department.
DL REVOCATION: 33 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 33 months.
Defendant already attended the Victim Impact Panel 
AODA Assessment and follow through

Defendant Luis J Ortiz Hernandez in court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to seek counsel.  Court reviews the conditions with the defendant.  Defendant to report to WCS directly after court.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
